title.narrative: NATIONAL CAPACITY FOR VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE

description.narrative: Increased country capacity to promote and ensure justice that enables the prevention and treatment of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, National legislation is implemented to prevent, mitigate and address violence and other childhood abuses and the justice, education, public health, security and other sectors observe children's rights to this protection.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased country capacity to promote and ensure justice that enables the prevention and treatment of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect

description.narrative: Children in conflict with the law will have access to more child-friendly justice services thanks to the island-wide roll-out of the National Child Diversion Programme, developed with UNICEF's technical assistance. More than 12,000 children stand to gain from the increased capacity of police officers to implement the Child Justice Guidelines, through a training programme developed and rolled out in partnership with the Office of the Children's Advocate (OCA), along with the island-wide dissemination of user-friendly job aids for police officers to police stations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/02/2020

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

actual.value: 2019:Sensitization sessions for key partners on Child Diversion were conducted and training schedule ready to start in 2020

title.narrative: Justice and Security professionals and primary caregivers in state institutions trained to use rehabilitation approaches
Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect
